  37. BadJustin Moderator Staff Member

    Joined:
    Oct 2, 2013
    Location:
    Complaint Dept.
    Page:
    2
    Post ID:
    1904178
    Date:
    2018-11-09 10:54
    I will share this for full transparency. I have posted this in the Admin PM. As i said when I got made a mod, I will and have advocated for us, the users and I will continue to do so. So at least I said what was on everyone's minds, albeit more tactfully than you assholes would have. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

    BadJustin said: > ↑ >
    >
    I'll be that guy, because i always have been.
    >
    > This is gonna end badly. Maybe I can offer some insight. To be frank, no one is going to subscribe, honestly. A couple of reasons as to why I think this is the case:
    >
    > This is EXACTLY what Beer Advocate does, which you probably don't know, is why this site even exists, we all got banned from there back in 2013. This already strikes a lot of users are "following in their footsteps". This is a bad thing in their eyes.
    >
    > In the past funds for hosting, maintenance and what not were generated by T-shirt sales, glasses which were all different, hooded sweatshirts, stickers etc. Perhaps we can revisit that option?
    >
    > A lot of the base feel that there are other issues plaguing the site therefore they would like those to be addressed prior to soliciting funds from anyone, also see reason #1.
    >
    > The lack of interaction is taken seriously by them. Trivial? Maybe, but they don't feel as though it is an "us" community anymore. Dare i say, some feel it's an "us vs. them" sort of situation. I know this seems silly since this is an internet message board, about beer, but it really is truly more than that. We have built a literal community. A lot of us are now all friends in real life and talk regularly, all because of TB. Hopefully that explains why they feel the way the do in regards to the interaction.
    >
    > I fully understand this is your site and that you folks can and will do what you'd like, I respect that. I am just being fully open and honest here.
    >
    > Ask Gene, I don't sugar coat things, never have, never will.
    >
    > I write this with zero animosity, just offering some backstory of why this is going the way it is. Either they will subscribe or they won't, it is what it is. I honestly hops this helps shed some light on things.
    >
    > -Justin
    >

    Page:
    4
    Post ID:
    1904292
    Date:
    2018-11-09 11:48
    I have a question for all of you that are so upset!

    What is different on your use of the site? Has anyone twisted your arm, has anyone made you do anything? Was something put in place and turned on without telling you? Yes, it was put in place and no one said you had to do anything and nothing was taken away from you. Not one damn thing was changed in your experience of the site.

    You did not have to do anything, you still get to use the site today as you used it yesterday before that was turned on. So, what has changed? Not one thing for you.

    Should I have announced it? Why would I when I have seen how you act. If asked about it, yes I would have explained more. And I did leave that 3 stickers are going to be added to the deal so you get something for your money. And if $0.027 cents a day is so dreadful for you, don't participate in Supporting Membership. ($9.95 a year).

    YOU are and have a really neat forum here. I like what I call your Misfitness, it's a neat place to relax and not have to worry about a word here or there. But this upset over something that does nothing to anyone, does not take one thing away from you is not logical.

    BOTTOM LINE: That Supporting Membership option is going to be available to anyone that WANTS to do so. No one is making anyone do it. Nothing is being taken away. Heck, we even have it where you don't have to see ads.

  69. BadJustin Moderator Staff Member

    Joined:
    Oct 2, 2013
    Location:
    Complaint Dept.
    Page:
    4
    Post ID:
    1904298
    Date:
    2018-11-09 11:53
    Ok, so here is the deal. Don't shoot the fucking messenger please.

    The supporter option WILL be turned back on. Now hold the fuck up please, before the sky seems to start falling, no one has to subscribe. If you don't want to, then fuck it, don't. We all knew this would probably happen eventually and does it sting now that it has? Sure, I am right there with you guys. I know there are a lot of gripes with site performance, I get it, I am on here all day too, member? So when Twitter embeds get fucky, 99.9% of the time, it's not the site, it's that something has changed with the Twitter flux capacitor (IDK what it's really called).

    I do know that Fenyx has been working to get the pics fixed and she's done some other maintenance. I think what you guys tend to forget is with Gene and Steve we had a dedicated in house IT team and this was their site and first priority, Fenyx admins on multiple other boards, so does shit sometimes take longer than it did in the past to get resolved? Sure. Is it ideal? No, but it is what it is.

    Am I playing Devils Advocate here? Yeah, I am, I can't help but do it. Listen guys, I know a lot of you don't like it, totally justifiable and understandable but again, you don't have to buy in to supporter status. No, there won't be a magazine, cause I don't have the time for that shit and every issue would just be pictures of Dickbutt.

    Shit if Scott didn't point it out, you guys would have never known. Am I taken aback by it? Sure, I voiced my reasons as to why on the last page. It has come to light that there would have been an announcement but how do you expect someone who doesn't really get the TB demographic to word that so you guys didn't chew her up and spit her out? Honestly. I get why she was waiting, chances are she probably would have asked me.

    So again, so it's not a surprise to anyone, the option will be back up, the choice on utilizing it is all up to you. No other sections or access will be throttled or restricted or for supporters only, perhaps a supporters only section that opens up when you join but none of the current content will be impacted.

  82. trickytunadicky

    Joined:
    Jan 30, 2014
    Location:
    Chicagoish
    Page:
    5
    Post ID:
    1904322
    Date:
    2018-11-09 12:07
    I host a website so I get asking for money to pay for costs related to covering that specific stuff. I don’t use the photo hosting, so I am not in for that. My experience here has changed. Not in one big way but in a lot of small ways. A bunch of my friends I enjoyed chatting with have quit, the pics I don’t use don’t show up in quotes and I can’r be sussed to go back and look at what was quoted or click the link, people are irritable all the time. It’s death by a thousand cuts. I won’t quit in some big flash, but much like when I left BA and RB one day I will just stop logging in because it stops being fun. You asked so there is my honest response.

    I will stop logging in faster if this place develops that two tier culture of RateBeer where you aren’t really part of the community if you don’t pay to support the site with a membership. The shitty culture is what made me not want to pay.

    Can you explain about the pics you don't use, don't show up in quotes, etc.
    >
     
    I’d be more concerned about the friends that quit.

  90. nathanmiller

    Joined:
    Oct 1, 2013
    Location:
    Where Brooklyn At
    Page:
    5
    Post ID:
    1904339
    Date:
    2018-11-09 12:19
    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    I have a question for all of you that are so upset!
    >
    I suspect that this will fall on deaf ears like so many other responses ever since TxBrew bought this place, but what the hell.

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    What is different on your use of the site?
    >
    Aside from the fact that it falls over on a regular schedule? Aside from Hanzo's avatar? Aside from images not working pretty frequently? Aside from twitter embeds breaking things? Aside from losing Photekut likes? Aside from whatever the hell a bad gateway is?

    Honestly, it sucks that this community is no longer owned by someone who is a part of it. It sucks that this community is just a property in a portfolio. But what is different aside from all the things above and more, as of now? It truly sucks that someone has taken the good will of talkbeer and attempted to turn it into an attempt for max profitz.

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    Has anyone twisted your arm, has anyone made you do anything?
    >
    No? But does that make this any less sleazy? Also, we all know where this goes next. Normally slippery slope arguments aren't great, but we've seen how this has played out at BA, and in addition, we've seen the actual slippery slope that has occurred since TxBrew took over. Things have degraded slowly and surely, and so pardon those of us who think that not only is it the wrong time to ask for money, but it's a near-guarantee that the site experience will degrade faster for those who don't pony up.

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    Was something put in place and turned on without telling you?
    >
    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    Yes
    >
    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    it was put in place and no one said you had to do anything and nothing was taken away from you. Not one damn thing was changed in your experience of the site. You did not have to do anything, you still get to use the site today as you used it yesterday before that was turned on. So, what has changed? Not one thing for you.
    >
    See above. But since this seems to be an important question, allow me to phrase my answer slightly differently. There's something particularly galling about asking for money at this time, and because of the behavior/attitude/experience since the new ownership came in, it feels a lot more like "protection money" than anything else. Sure, you don't have to pay for a private fire department, but you might think differently when your house is burning. It feels a lot like our house is burning and you're holding the match and asking for money to turn on the hoses.

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    Should I have announced it? Why would I when I have seen how you act.
    >
    Okay okay so we're at fault now.

    One of the many issues at play here is perception. It has been from day one, something I've said in every thread where TxBrew bothered to show up, as things started falling apart. The perception is seriously terrible. Should you have announced it? Yes, obviously. You screwed up. You could have rolled something out like this and explained, transparently, other avenues in which revenue was being made. You could (should) have waited until a period of calm, when users were again happy with the site, rather than in a time when the damn thing still falls over on a regular schedule. Or, alternatively, you could do so under the cover of silence, and then blame "how you act" when called out.

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    If asked about it, yes I would have explained more.
    >
    Is this angry backlash in the form of the same question over and over again your version of "explaining more"?

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    And I did leave that 3 stickers are going to be added to the deal so you get something for your money.
    >
    Legit question though: talkbeer.com stickers or Brady cute dick bro stickers? Cuz this might change my whole opinion of this thing, so answer wisely. Seriously though, coming in after the fact and saying "well you're gonna get some stickers for your money!" - do you believe us to be children? I know sometimes we act immaturely, but if you want to sell us stickers, go for it - there's a Shop button up top and a lot of us have willingly spent money on these and other things. And then we can decide if the cost per sticker is worth it to us or not.

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    And if $0.027 cents a day is so dreadful for you, don't participate in Supporting Membership. ($9.95 a year).
    >
    Really? This comes off as so absurdly condescending. I again ask if you think we're children.

    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    YOU are and have a really neat forum here. I like what I call your Misfitness, it's a neat place to relax and not have to worry about a word here or there. But this upset over something that does nothing to anyone, does not take one thing away from you is not logical.
    >
    > BOTTOM LINE: That Supporting Membership option is going to be available to anyone that WANTS to do so. No one is making anyone do it. Nothing is being taken away. Heck, we even have it where you don't have to see ads.
    >
     
    OK so I'm exhausted and about to be late to my spin class so I'm gonna wrap this up. Earlier in this thread, you suggested you were going to look to turn this "feature" off. And now you're saying the opposite. I don't have time to dissect this any more than I already have, but it's clear from your tone, content, and liberal use of too many spaces between sentences that you are not fully in control of your beliefs/feelings here. I want to like you. I want you to fit in here. I also want Brubaker to be the only one who has paid for this and for you to realize that adding this "feature" might not have been worth $9.95 of your time.

    >
      >
    • Less advertising.
      • >
    • NO mobile advertising
      • >
    • Unlimited private message space.
      • >
    • Unlimited file attachment space.
      • >
    • Unlimited gallery space.
      • >
    >
     
    So my questions:
    How much more advertising will we see? Will these additional ads impact functionality?
    Why would eliminating the Amazon ad on mobile phones help when, in theory, this site gets a cut of what we purchase off Amazon? Or is it just that we’re about to see a crap ton more ads, in general?
    How much space do us non-paying yokels get for PMs, files and gallery space?

  97. JoeLikesBeer

    Joined:
    Nov 11, 2013
    Page:
    5
    Post ID:
    1904352
    Date:
    2018-11-09 12:29
    I literally changed my default amazon shortcut from Shriner's hospital to TalkBeer a few years ago. Also think both homebrewtalk and ratebeer are eye and brain cancer.

    Since I have no place telling you how to run your shit here I go telling you how to run your shit...

    I'd humbly suggest that, if you (powers that be) need the fundage, you follow the Patreon model that so many educational and hobbyist youtubers are finding success with and now it appears youtube is trying to assimilate a little - support is optional, appreciated, and comes with perks that don't deny access to anything for the remaining non-supporting participants. Not saying you should use Patreon, just follow that sentiment.

    This site is made of UGC. Every UGC site that fails does so because they behave in ways that cause their U's to G less quality C. Segmented access walls off a shit ton of cheap and clever smartasses wasting away their work hours entertaining the rest of your users. It's like owning a nightclub and charging drink minimums to all the attractive women because you don't think they buy enough booze and are just loitering around.

    > One of the many issues at play here is perception. It has been from day one, something I've said in every thread where TxBrew bothered to show up, as things started falling apart. The perception is seriously terrible. Should you have announced it? Yes, obviously. You screwed up. You could have rolled something out like this and explained, transparently, other avenues in which revenue was being made. You could (should) have waited until a period of calm, when users were again happy with the site, rather than in a time when the damn thing still falls over on a regular schedule. Or, alternatively, you could do so under the cover of silence, and then blame "how you act" when called out.
    >
    > Is this angry backlash in the form of the same question over and over again your version of "explaining more"?
    >
    > Legit question though: talkbeer.com stickers or Brady cute dick bro stickers? Cuz this might change my whole opinion of this thing, so answer wisely. Seriously though, coming in after the fact and saying "well you're gonna get some stickers for your money!" - do you believe us to be children? I know sometimes we act immaturely, but if you want to sell us stickers, go for it - there's a Shop button up top and a lot of us have willingly spent money on these and other things. And then we can decide if the cost per sticker is worth it to us or not.
    >
    > Really? This comes off as so absurdly condescending. I again ask if you think we're children.
    >
    > OK so I'm exhausted and about to be late to my spin class so I'm gonna wrap this up. Earlier in this thread, you suggested you were going to look to turn this "feature" off. And now you're saying the opposite. I don't have time to dissect this any more than I already have, but it's clear from your tone, content, and liberal use of too many spaces between sentences that you are not fully in control of your beliefs/feelings here. I want to like you. I want you to fit in here. I also want Brubaker to be the only one who has paid for this and for you to realize that adding this "feature" might not have been worth $9.95 of your time.
    >
     
    INRAT

    nathanmiller said: > ↑ >
    >
    I suspect that this will fall on deaf ears like so many other responses ever since TxBrew bought this place, but what the hell.
    >
    > Aside from the fact that it falls over on a regular schedule? Aside from Hanzo's avatar? Aside from images not working pretty frequently? Aside from twitter embeds breaking things? Aside from losing Photekut likes? Aside from whatever the hell a bad gateway is?
    >
    > Honestly, it sucks that this community is no longer owned by someone who is a part of it. It sucks that this community is just a property in a portfolio. But what is different aside from all the things above and more, as of now? It truly sucks that someone has taken the good will of talkbeer and attempted to turn it into an attempt for max profitz.
    >
    > No? But does that make this any less sleazy? Also, we all know where this goes next. Normally slippery slope arguments aren't great, but we've seen how this has played out at BA, and in addition, we've seen the actual slippery slope that has occurred since TxBrew took over. Things have degraded slowly and surely, and so pardon those of us who think that not only is it the wrong time to ask for money, but it's a near-guarantee that the site experience will degrade faster for those who don't pony up.
    >
    > See above. But since this seems to be an important question, allow me to phrase my answer slightly differently. There's something particularly galling about asking for money at this time, and because of the behavior/attitude/experience since the new ownership came in, it feels a lot more like "protection money" than anything else. Sure, you don't have to pay for a private fire department, but you might think differently when your house is burning. It feels a lot like our house is burning and you're holding the match and asking for money to turn on the hoses.
    >
    > Okay okay so we're at fault now.
    >
    > One of the many issues at play here is perception. It has been from day one, something I've said in every thread where TxBrew bothered to show up, as things started falling apart. The perception is seriously terrible. Should you have announced it? Yes, obviously. You screwed up. You could have rolled something out like this and explained, transparently, other avenues in which revenue was being made. You could (should) have waited until a period of calm, when users were again happy with the site, rather than in a time when the damn thing still falls over on a regular schedule. Or, alternatively, you could do so under the cover of silence, and then blame "how you act" when called out.
    >
    > Is this angry backlash in the form of the same question over and over again your version of "explaining more"?
    >
    > Legit question though: talkbeer.com stickers or Brady cute dick bro stickers? Cuz this might change my whole opinion of this thing, so answer wisely. Seriously though, coming in after the fact and saying "well you're gonna get some stickers for your money!" - do you believe us to be children? I know sometimes we act immaturely, but if you want to sell us stickers, go for it - there's a Shop button up top and a lot of us have willingly spent money on these and other things. And then we can decide if the cost per sticker is worth it to us or not.
    >
    > Really? This comes off as so absurdly condescending. I again ask if you think we're children.
    >
    > OK so I'm exhausted and about to be late to my spin class so I'm gonna wrap this up. Earlier in this thread, you suggested you were going to look to turn this "feature" off. And now you're saying the opposite. I don't have time to dissect this any more than I already have, but it's clear from your tone, content, and liberal use of too many spaces between sentences that you are not fully in control of your beliefs/feelings here. I want to like you. I want you to fit in here. I also want Brubaker to be the only one who has paid for this and for you to realize that adding this "feature" might not have been worth $9.95 of your time.
    >

    I'll stick around and see how this plays out, but only because my main line of communication to some of my very favorite people in the world is thru this site and it'd just be kind of a pain in the ass to go set up something on another site.

  117. Kasher

    Joined:
    Oct 29, 2013
    Location:
    Long Island, NY
    Page:
    6
    Post ID:
    1904405
    Date:
    2018-11-09 13:10
    I think everyone just about covered it Fenyx but just as additional support for the general opinions:

    Everyone has just about everyone else's back here (let's not try and find exceptions to that rule, but just nod and agree that a few do exist) and it's slowly migrated from being about beer, to being about making fun of our shitty lives and commiserating with one another while getting heavily intoxicated.

    I could be wrong, but if there was a post that said "Yearly maintenance fees for Talkbeer.com" and a couple bullet points with a total amount needed and all the "perks" of paying $10 a year being renamed "What's coming in 2019" with a link to a GoFundMe page, the bar would probably be filled already. People are willing to support this website.

    Since the change in ownership, a lot of people (even myself a bit now) feel like something that they were "invested" in and had a "say" in decisions of has been taken away from them. This isn't to say buying and selling is bad, but this website has gone from a grasroots community to being owned by the beer drinking forum equivalent of a person-less conglomerate who just has "holdings".

    It's 100% OK to have a business model and business plan. But I'm confident trying to shoe-horn that model here isn't going to be successful. It's up to the 2 (3?) of you to decide if you're interested in personalizing the model for this website or continue looking at TalkBeer as just another "holding" in your portfolio.

    When uploading as attachments, it enables the images to stay with the thread. When doing a link such as a photobucket when they decide to cut off third party postings unless you pay about $30 a month, and all go black - that is a problem on some sites. This one, you'd not be able to see that fine or horrible beer you were partaking of. On technical sites, it is whether you can see a schematic or not.

  146. Fenyx Administrator Staff Member

    Joined:
    Sep 18, 2018
    Page:
    8
    Post ID:
    1904463
    Date:
    2018-11-09 13:52
    Shaggs said: > ↑ >
    >
    Stop treating the site and the people as an IT ticket that needs to be fixed and maybe try and get where people are coming from. A little empathy goes a long way. It's the reason BadJustin gets along so well with so many people
    >
     
    Let me tell you what I see from my experience.
    In 2012 the site I'd been involved in as a member working up through the staff steps to head admin was purchased in 2012. And it was much larger than this site, but the people, members and friends were as pissed off about it as you are. The mods raked the original owner over the coals for doing selling the site.
    I spent the next 3 years putting up with members not liking anything the new owners did. Some mods being asses and such, and I was in the middle.
    I know the feeling. I could just say Tough, this is how it is and not try to work with you all, but I think more of members of a site than to do that for all of you.
    And I don't know you all other than on the surface, but I recognize the feelings about your love for TalkBeer and this site having changes is the absolute pits.

    But I refuse to act as if I'm one of you at this time. I may be getting to know you, but I"m not a true TalkBeer person yet. One day I may be, but it's not going to be easy or quick.

    I am really trying to help you Fenyx but if you want to understand the animosity, I would advise (not joking) spending like 30-40 hours refreshing the new posts to see what the actual conversation going on on the website is like. The new ownership basically came in and made a first post trade deal that was roundly rejected

    https://www.talkbeer.com/community/threads/ft-kbbs-pre-iso-pappy-20.36561/

    That thread is a metaphor for new ownership.

    • first post only has 1 like from Photekut
    • let's talk ratios
    • in it to win it
    • way off base in the price evaluation of what they are holding
    • no pre-existing relationship with the community
    • first response is a gif that has nothing to do with the original post
    • doesn't understand why people are making fun of them
    • says other people are butt hurt
    • says they can walk away and ignore the original post
    • responds with "I have seen this get done the other way" (on FB)
    I could go on and on, but really this sums it up

    Compton25 said: > ↑ >
    >
    The only time you come into our community is to post shitty ass ISO, you literally contribute no where else. So for old time's sake...
    >
    > http://i.imgur.com/5RrPLgX.gif >
    >
     
    When the ownership ditches and the only posts are shitty ass ISO's for yearly memberships you don't understand "our community".

    Multiple times you have referred to the fact that "nothing has changed" for a persons experience but you are focusing on the technical details. The reason people are angry is because the ownership/community/tone has changed and we have seen declining performance and then an ask for money.

    Philosophically I think it is also important that this particular change was ownership driven. If you go back an read posts from 3-4 years ago people were literally begging Gene to be able to give him money. Transparency and feedback would have been huge. Something like "Hey we have $2,000 in server and hosting costs that we need to recoup, which of these three options would be best..." Community driven vs. Ownership driven makes a difference.
     


  238. Pierre Pressure

    Joined:
    Jun 30, 2017
    Location:
    Pittsburgh
    Page:
    12
    Post ID:
    1904653
    Date:
    2018-11-09 15:41
    Fenyx said: > ↑ >
    >
    tosh = Sorry about the snarky, but I want to be snarky too. This is the place for it.
    > And he did that? I'll have to research that as I was not on this site at that time.
    >
    > Bottom line. Unfortunately or fortunately, you're stuck with me.
    >
     
    Are you familiar with the phrase "there is a time and a place for ____"? Personally I don't care if the owners want to start charging money or making premium memberships or whatever...if I don't like it I'll just leave, no skin off my back. But if this is the treatment that users are getting when they are voicing concerns about things...why the hell would I ever want to support a place like that? You started out by blaming users for your decision to not announce this before. You've posted flippant responses to people's concerns and then doubled down by saying you too want to be snarky.

    You might be a fantastic IT person and general admin, but as a community manager, which is largely the function you are performing in this thread, you are falling far short. What are you trying to accomplish with your presence in this thread? Are you trying to resolve the issue or to piss people off further? You admit that you aren't too in tune with the users of this site and it's history. You have had people tell you that this site started in large part because of other similar sites showing disregard for their users. And with this information you....decided that it was the time and place to be snarky to the users and show the same type of attitude that people disliked about the powers that be of those other sites.

    I've nothing against you or this site. You've got an angry mob on your hands and that sucks to deal with, I get it. I love watching the world burn as much as the next guy but...I kind of like this site and some of the people on it, so I'd implore you to consider using a bit more tact in handling these responses instead of doubling down and making things needlessly adversarial.

    > I'd humbly suggest that, if you (powers that be) need the fundage, you follow the Patreon model that so many educational and hobbyist youtubers are finding success with and now it appears youtube is trying to assimilate a little - support is optional, appreciated, and comes with perks that don't deny access to anything for the remaining non-supporting participants.     >
    > This site is made of UGC. Every UGC site that fails does so because they behave in ways that cause their U's to G less quality C. Segmented access walls off a shit ton of cheap and clever smartasses wasting away their work hours entertaining the rest of your users.     Galaxy Brain: there are no good fast food burgers

    Ok, so I think this thread is mostly a massive overreaction, but making avatars bigger is stupid. Like "how do you put on pants in the morning?" stupid.     Can we just go back to the way shit was yesterday evening and have a normal fucking discussion about how to make this all work? You know, treating the users like actual fucking adults instead of a bunch of morons to monetize? We all get that enough everywhere else online.

    Seriously, is an enlarged (heh?) avatar supposed to be a fun bonus? Is there some kind of symbolism here about "mine is bigger than yours" which --- oh fuck, okay, Brian as a supporter makes sense now.

    Yeah I'm on the same page here. I don't even have a fundamental problem with the idea of premium memberships, and most of the perks seem like things that are fine to offer given that they don't really hurt anyone who doesn't want them (unlimited file storage, etc), but this avatar thing is really dumb.

    Steve said: > ↑ >
    >
    Deleted a comment just now. (Personal attack) Folks, at the end of the day it’s a beer website. Telling someone to go fuck themselves over this is the definition of taking things (this specifically) too seriously.
    >
    > For full transparency, I agreed with what justin post earlier that he said in our mod conversation. I also expressed how it’d be helpful for us (the modding team) to be aware of things ahead of time. That said: let’s not stoop to that level. It’s silly.

    I'm perfectly calm and don't need to "calm down." As most of these fine folks can attest, I'll write you a literal fucking novel if you get me irritated. Telling someone to "go fuck yourself" is brevity I can rarely muster.

    Being condescended to by e-admins is not something I signed up for. It's not what I had in mind when I purchased things via the website for the purpose of supporting it. It's not what I had in mind when I made sure to always buy from Amazon through TalkBeer or whitelisted the site on whatever script/ad blocking software I use on any device.

    In fact, it is the literal definition of what I came to this site specifically to get away from. Now that TalkBeer is just another forum with admins sneering down their noses at users, it's come full circle to exactly what brought people here in the first place. It's not the premium membership - it's the attitude.

    I hope you guys are proud to know that for all TalkBeer ever was and what it meant to people who just wanted to dick around on the internet talking about beer and life, it looks like ol Todd still won in the end, didn't he?

    Same thing is called chip in united kingdom. I have this in mcdonald restaurant from scotland? They make with a bath of boiling oil. Is just make potato taste of american corn grease and salt. Real fried potato is in pan with onion. They have this too in scottish restaurant in united kingdom when I visit and this is how we make in home. Much better to eat with salted fish they have and egg for breakfast. Most potato I use is with dumpling or roast with herb or boil with stew. This will not make as much fat like custard woman from america wisconsin.

    >
     

    Seems money makes those feelings better, I’ll cut his loss and I know folks here would chip in to assist anyways.

    I don’t even mind the asking for money, or the changes they expect, but holy shit, the edited posts and the total radio silence speaks... well, volumes around here.

    Having seen both sides and been on both sides, I can firmly say that taking advantage of a sites values is a fine line, one to keep it going and one to make your mortgage. Profiting off friendships and goodwill just doesn’t fly, and there’s a marked difference in maintaining and margins.

    I just can’t get past the gap between the site ownership and the membership. If it was involved, I’d almost be sure they’ve have us all for the 19.95... or 9.95 price. Instead we are questioned over the daily cost of lost change in the couch or dryer for the site cost and told to sack up.

I haven’t been impressed with TxBrew or Fenyx but there’s bigger culprits in this site’s slow march to death.
    >
     
    Sorry for partying

  507. MrDave

    Joined:
    Oct 1, 2013
    Location:
    Concord,...
    Page:
    26
    Post ID:
    1905420
    Date:
    2018-11-10 09:58
    This was hands down my least favorite week on TalkBeer.

    I'm off to Seattle for a few days and I don't expect to check in. I hope you're all here when I get back later in the week. Please don't overreact to the point of leaving the site over all this stupid shit. Should there be an exodus - and time will tell - it should be coordinated for maximum impact. An established destination is essential. The community is important, not where it dwells.

    To those who own, manage, or work for TalkBeer, listen to your community. I know most of you are trying to bring order to chaos and it feels like a thankless task, but try to decipher which users are busting balls, which are always going to whine about anything, and which ones are legitimately raising concerns. While a lot of this seems like bitching about small innocuous changes, I believe the shared concern is that shit like this will break the community up by driving users away over time. That's a valid concern if you value the users beyond however site valuation works. I know most mods do, but I don't know about this IT guy, and I would expect otherwise with the ownership.

    And please stop with the "it's just a beer forum" shit. That's patronizing as all hell.

    No offense, but why would he? Would you harass the next owner of your home after you sold it because you hated the way they cut the shrubs, or that they didn’t ask you about what color to paint the bathrooms?

    I get it, the changes blow, the lack of transparency( if we are acting like we should have it ), the lack of involvement... Hell the lack of everything to be honest in showing to be a good steward of the site is annoying. The new ownership sucks and it’s simply an ad renvue venue like most online sites have it end up becoming.

    I’m never mad at someone who build something and sold it and just so happened to make a buck doing so. Gene has little to no control over how it ended when the keys were handed over, and while many can be upset it happened, it did, and it wasn’t open to discussion. We don’t know his situation with time, family or finance, or quite frankly wanting to deal with how dramatic we all are here.

    Give the battle drum against gene a rest, will ya. He didn’t touch your balls or anything, he sold his website because he didn’t have time for it and expected everyone wanted it around still. He thought he had a good buyer, and that wasn’t the case after the point. He didn’t fuck anything up on his end.

    The owner of the TxBrew account will no longer be using that account or returning to TB. The torch has been passed to Fenyx. There are different levels of admin access and with his being the highest, it can't just go away.

    I might be on beer a little, but this is a profoundly stupid take on things. Yes, this shit isn't particularly important in the grand scheme of things, but in the grand scheme of things literally nothing is important.

    Many of the people on this forum hold it dear and don't want to see it neglected/maligned and will react harshly. Is that irrational? Sure, see above re: malaria nets. But it doesn't make it less true and it doesn't make your reaction less pointless and patronizing.

  726. Gene

    North Jersey / NYC
    Page:
    37
    Post ID:
    1906483
    Date:
    2018-11-12 08:24
    tosh - I think more people would have an easier time seeing how much you care about the community if you’d stop gloating over how you predicted it would fall apart, encouraging the mods to quit, watching like a hawk for every misstep and then amplifying them through a megaphone... these are strangely destructive actions for someone whom I actually know cares deeply about this place. So yes, you certainly have been a highly active element in driving things to their current state, and you seem at this point to be acting with intent to destroy it entirely.

    It doesn’t make sense to me, and it’s why many of us have expressed frustration. It’s not because we “hate you.” I don’t even know you, so I have no basis for that sort of blanket attitude. Our mutual friends tell me you are really a wonderful guy, and I believe them. I am just increasingly confused and frustrated as to why someone who cares so deeply would act so recklessly to accelerate bad outcomes.
     


  727. Gene

    Joined:
    Mar 14, 2013
    Location:
    North Jersey / NYC
    Page:
    37
    Post ID:
    1906485
    Date:
    2018-11-12 08:24
    So, with that clarified, here’s where I think we should go from here to try and fix things up. To start, I would love to see folks get very specific at helping Fenyx to right the ship. What are your ideas for how she can improve the site and build the community? What are some better models for generating revenue, or how could the premium supporter feature actually be made worthwhile in your minds? I believe she is definitely willing to listen and put constructive criticism into action.

    Here’s a great example:
    JoeLikesBeer said: > ↑ >
    >
    I literally changed my default amazon shortcut from Shriner's hospital to TalkBeer a few years ago. Also think both homebrewtalk and ratebeer are eye and brain cancer.
    >
    > Since I have no place telling you how to run your shit here I go telling you how to run your shit...
    >
    > I'd humbly suggest that, if you (powers that be) need the fundage, you follow the Patreon model that so many educational and hobbyist youtubers are finding success with and now it appears youtube is trying to assimilate a little - support is optional, appreciated, and comes with perks that don't deny access to anything for the remaining non-supporting participants. Not saying you should use Patreon, just follow that sentiment.
    >
    > This site is made of UGC. Every UGC site that fails does so because they behave in ways that cause their U's to G less quality C. Segmented access walls off a shit ton of cheap and clever smartasses wasting away their work hours entertaining the rest of your users. It's like owning a nightclub and charging drink minimums to all the attractive women because you don't think they buy enough booze and are just loitering around.
    >

  729. Brady Moderator Staff Member

    Joined:
    Apr 5, 2013
    Location:
    South Jersey
    Page:
    37
    Post ID:
    1906500
    Date:
    2018-11-12 08:39
    tosh said: > ↑ >
    >
    If I wake up and this list is the same I will be disappointed
    >
    > View attachment 2289 >
    >
    > MarkIntihar Brady BadJustin please do the right thing and leave thesr fuckchops to figure it out in the dark.
    >
    > I mean the two people who could help jumped ship why should you care?
    >
     
    "Do the Right Thing".

    Just because you have spent a lot of time on this website does not give you ownership. If you go to my profile page, and check the URL, it shows which user # you are.

    I'm user #3 dude. #3. The only guys here before me were Gene and Os, and that's because we were all putting this site together. Populating it, bringing in our friends and trade partners. Building up BeerTrading.org (naming it in of itself was it's own thing).

    You don't get to tell me what the right thing is. Period.

    This site has evolved constantly (sometimes slower than other times), but still constantly. Not always for the better, but it grew, and changed, and shifted. It changed when BeerAdvocate had massive bannings 6 months after we started here, and the user population exploded, and we had to bring in more mods to control the shitposting. Folks were mad about more mods, and some left because they couldn't adjust to limitations to content (see: homie). It changed when we changed the name from BeerTrading.org to TalkBeer.com, trying to shift away from being an another terrible ISO:FT board, and emphasizing the community conversation threads. Heavy traders were mad that they now had to start contributing to the boards, and some left because they couldn't adjust too (RIP Photekut). Some people were upset that Gene changed the logo from a legible font to MSPaint, but nobody really left over it because that would be stupid.

    But that's just it; any change is just a part of this site. Use it, don't use it, make your choice, but your campaign against those in control is just stupid. I hope you do what Gene did 6 years ago and decide to start your own forum, one where you can post whatever you want and everybody on the site will pay attention and give you the praise you want, but this isn't your site. It's not mine either, and I don't even think that the new ownership can really claim that it's "theirs" either.

    This is a community. You can own the name, the domain, the intellectual properties. You can charge for additional content, you can block users from accessing certain parts, you can sell bigger avatar image blocks. It doesn't change a thing, and if you think that it does, you're being dumb. Everyone here is just a part of it, not an owner, so you don't get to pick and choose how others act and react on the site.

    Least of all me. I've been here before you, and will be after. /rant

    >
     
    You don’t know a fucking thing about my bollocks, so you can quit talking like you do.

    Admittedly, things haven’t gone exactly the way I expected since the site sale. I’m disappointed in the direction the site seems to be going in, but I understand it. IRL, dealing with change is essentially my entire job, so I’m much less averse to it than most, I suppose.

    Quite frankly, I was asked by Gene to be a mod during a different time in my life when I literally spent 20 hours a day on the site. I’m much less involved now, mostly because life is busier now, but I’d be dishonest if I said the general attitude of the community over the last couple years didn’t have anything to do with it.

    Perhaps this sounds like revisionist history to align with my lack of interest in doing anything dramatic in response to the recent management decisions, but I’d challenge you to go back and look at all the various threads I used to participate in regularly vs my level of involvement now and I think you’ll find it’s consistent with my message above.

    First they came for evilc, and I did not speak out—
    Because I was not evilc.

    Then they came for the pastry boys, and I did not speak out—
    Because I was not a pastry boy.

    Then they came for the BIFers, and I did not speak out—
    Because I was not a BIFer.

    Then they came for me—and there was no one left to speak for me.

    Obviously a lot of us aren’t happy with recent changes, but I still believe in this community. For me it’s a glass half full or half empty kind of approach. For all of our issues, this place is still full of the best group of assholes I’ve ever met.

    I’ve made lifelong friends here and we’ve done a lot of good thru various BIFs, LIFs, and random acts of support and kindness for each other. I don’t want to see that go away. It’s easy to walk away when this stuff happens, but I’d encourage everyone to work together and keep this community going.

    Gene said: > ↑ >
    >
    tosh - I think more people would have an easier time seeing how much you care about the community if you’d stop gloating over how you predicted it would fall apart, encouraging the mods to quit, watching like a hawk for every misstep and then amplifying them through a megaphone... these are strangely destructive actions for someone whom I actually know cares deeply about this place. So yes, you certainly have been a highly active element in driving things to their current state, and you seem at this point to be acting with intent to destroy it entirely.
    >
    > It doesn’t make sense to me, and it’s why many of us have expressed frustration. It’s not because we “hate you.” I don’t even know you, so I have no basis for that sort of blanket attitude. Our mutual friends tell me you are really a wonderful guy, and I believe them. I am just increasingly confused and frustrated as to why someone who cares so deeply would act so recklessly to accelerate bad outcomes.
    >
    Brady said: > ↑ >
    >
    "Do the Right Thing".
    >
    > Just because you have spent a lot of time on this website does not give you ownership. If you go to my profile page, and check the URL, it shows which user # you are.
    >
    > I'm user #3 dude. #3. The only guys here before me were Gene and Os, and that's because we were all putting this site together. Populating it, bringing in our friends and trade partners. Building up BeerTrading.org (naming it in of itself was it's own thing).
    >
    > You don't get to tell me what the right thing is. Period.
    >
    > This site has evolved constantly (sometimes slower than other times), but still constantly. Not always for the better, but it grew, and changed, and shifted. It changed when BeerAdvocate had massive bannings 6 months after we started here, and the user population exploded, and we had to bring in more mods to control the shitposting. Folks were mad about more mods, and some left because they couldn't adjust to limitations to content (see: homie). It changed when we changed the name from BeerTrading.org to TalkBeer.com, trying to shift away from being an another terrible ISO:FT board, and emphasizing the community conversation threads. Heavy traders were mad that they now had to start contributing to the boards, and some left because they couldn't adjust too (RIP Photekut). Some people were upset that Gene changed the logo from a legible font to MSPaint, but nobody really left over it because that would be stupid.
    >
    > But that's just it; any change is just a part of this site. Use it, don't use it, make your choice, but your campaign against those in control is just stupid. I hope you do what Gene did 6 years ago and decide to start your own forum, one where you can post whatever you want and everybody on the site will pay attention and give you the praise you want, but this isn't your site. It's not mine either, and I don't even think that the new ownership can really claim that it's "theirs" either.
    >
    > This is a community. You can own the name, the domain, the intellectual properties. You can charge for additional content, you can block users from accessing certain parts, you can sell bigger avatar image blocks. It doesn't change a thing, and if you think that it does, you're being dumb. Everyone here is just a part of it, not an owner, so you don't get to pick and choose how others act and react on the site.
    >
    > Least of all me. I've been here before you, and will be after. /rant
    >
    MarkIntihar said: > ↑ >
    >
    You don’t know a fucking thing about my bollocks, so you can quit talking like you do.

So yes, you certainly have been a highly active element in driving things to their current state, and you seem at this point to be acting with intent to destroy it entirely.
    >
    > It doesn’t make sense to me, and it’s why many of us have expressed frustration. It’s not because we “hate you.” I don’t even know you, so I have no basis for that sort of blanket attitude. Our mutual friends tell me you are really a wonderful guy, and I believe them. I am just increasingly confused and frustrated as to why someone who cares so deeply would act so recklessly to accelerate bad outcomes.
    >
    Gene said: > ↑ >
    >
    So, with that clarified, here’s where I think we should go from here to try and fix things up. To start, I would love to see folks get very specific at helping Fenyx to right the ship. What are your ideas for how she can improve the site and build the community? What are some better models for generating revenue, or how could the premium supporter feature actually be made worthwhile in your minds? I believe she is definitely willing to listen and put constructive criticism into action.

  792. neorunner

    Joined:
    Apr 24, 2013
    Location:
    Fairfax, VA
    Page:
    40
    Post ID:
    1906839
    Date:
    2018-11-12 16:25
    TalkBeer is situated on a dedicated server(s) to serve you as fast as possible. Also we have VPS's to balance the https/file hosting/mail and store traffic along with archive servers retaining older content.

    Summary of Costs:
    • Dedicated site server
    • VPS(s) to balance http/https/store/mail/file hosting traffic
    • Dedicated store servers
    • Dedicated image hosting
    • Dedicated server(s) for archiving
    • Development server

    How to Donate
    • Click on the [Donate] button.
    • Click Buy Now that is adjacent to the amount you intend to donate.
    • Then select your payment option: Card or Digital Currency

    I can't find the donate button
    The [Donate] button is located next to the [Shop] button. If it is not there then donations are down for the time being. When donations are back up the button will reappear.

    What happens after I purchase/donate?
    • After a successful 'Purchase', you will receive everything in the package you selected.
    • The Donation Bar will increase based on your donation/purchase
    • Funds will be used to finance our servers and other costs
    • You will receive a donor symbol next to your username in the form of a http://alpharatio.cc/static/common/symbols/donor.png only if the item(s) you purchased have a value in Days in the "Donor Days" field.

    The Following reward sets are available:
    • Sponsor - [Price goes here] - 30 donor days, 2 TB stickers (first purchase only)
    • Homie - [Price goes here] - 180 donor days, 2 TB stickers (first purchase only)
    • Junior Mod - [Price goes here] - 1 year donor days, TB Junior Mod glass (first purchase only)
    • Crazy Pizza Package - [Obnoxious price goes here] - Lifetime donor days, rare swag, limited number available, BadJustin SnapChats, a watch.

    All perks will be added to your account within 60 minutes of purchasing, in some instances the cache may cause delays in users seeing the changes.

    It's been 48 hours and my purchase hasn't completed!
    Send a PM to a Mod with the subject "Donation Error"

    Example Donation bar:
    https://i.imgur.com/0tbO98I.png

  806. ant880

    Joined:
    Aug 28, 2013
    Location:
    NY
    Page:
    41
    Post ID:
    1906893
    Date:
    2018-11-12 17:26
    Gene said: > ↑ >
    >
    tosh - I think more people would have an easier time seeing how much you care about the community if you’d stop gloating over how you predicted it would fall apart, encouraging the mods to quit, watching like a hawk for every misstep and then amplifying them through a megaphone... these are strangely destructive actions for someone whom I actually know cares deeply about this place. So yes, you certainly have been a highly active element in driving things to their current state, and you seem at this point to be acting with intent to destroy it entirely.
    >
    > It doesn’t make sense to me, and it’s why many of us have expressed frustration. It’s not because we “hate you.” I don’t even know you, so I have no basis for that sort of blanket attitude. Our mutual friends tell me you are really a wonderful guy, and I believe them. I am just increasingly confused and frustrated as to why someone who cares so deeply would act so recklessly to accelerate bad outcomes.
    >
    Brady said: > ↑ >
    >
    "Do the Right Thing".
    >
    > Just because you have spent a lot of time on this website does not give you ownership. If you go to my profile page, and check the URL, it shows which user # you are.
    >
    > I'm user #3 dude. #3. The only guys here before me were Gene and Os, and that's because we were all putting this site together. Populating it, bringing in our friends and trade partners. Building up BeerTrading.org (naming it in of itself was it's own thing).
    >
    > You don't get to tell me what the right thing is. Period.
    >
    > This site has evolved constantly (sometimes slower than other times), but still constantly. Not always for the better, but it grew, and changed, and shifted. It changed when BeerAdvocate had massive bannings 6 months after we started here, and the user population exploded, and we had to bring in more mods to control the shitposting. Folks were mad about more mods, and some left because they couldn't adjust to limitations to content (see: homie). It changed when we changed the name from BeerTrading.org to TalkBeer.com, trying to shift away from being an another terrible ISO:FT board, and emphasizing the community conversation threads. Heavy traders were mad that they now had to start contributing to the boards, and some left because they couldn't adjust too (RIP Photekut). Some people were upset that Gene changed the logo from a legible font to MSPaint, but nobody really left over it because that would be stupid.
    >
    > But that's just it; any change is just a part of this site. Use it, don't use it, make your choice, but your campaign against those in control is just stupid. I hope you do what Gene did 6 years ago and decide to start your own forum, one where you can post whatever you want and everybody on the site will pay attention and give you the praise you want, but this isn't your site. It's not mine either, and I don't even think that the new ownership can really claim that it's "theirs" either.
    >
    > This is a community. You can own the name, the domain, the intellectual properties. You can charge for additional content, you can block users from accessing certain parts, you can sell bigger avatar image blocks. It doesn't change a thing, and if you think that it does, you're being dumb. Everyone here is just a part of it, not an owner, so you don't get to pick and choose how others act and react on the site.
    >
    > Least of all me. I've been here before you, and will be after. /rant
    >
    MarkIntihar said: > ↑ >
    >
    You don’t know a fucking thing about my bollocks, so you can quit talking like you do.
    >
    > Admittedly, things haven’t gone exactly the way I expected since the site sale. I’m disappointed in the direction the site seems to be going in, but I understand it. IRL, dealing with change is essentially my entire job, so I’m much less averse to it than most, I suppose.
    >
    > Quite frankly, I was asked by Gene to be a mod during a different time in my life when I literally spent 20 hours a day on the site. I’m much less involved now, mostly because life is busier now, but I’d be dishonest if I said the general attitude of the community over the last couple years didn’t have anything to do with it.
    >
    > Perhaps this sounds like revisionist history to align with my lack of interest in doing anything dramatic in response to the recent management decisions, but I’d challenge you to go back and look at all the various threads I used to participate in regularly vs my level of involvement now and I think you’ll find it’s consistent with my message above.
    >

  810. neorunner

    Location:
    Fairfax, VA
    Page:

    jmgrub said: > ↑ >
    >
    I love the donations idea (and would donate if there were assurances that things would remain largely the same (with fewer bad gateways)), but can't help but think that the intent of the premium membership was not just to defray operating costs, but rather to make a profit.
    >
     
    Factoring in a profit margin percentage on the back end isn't a difficult leap to make. The site has other venues of revenue than a membership platform that has never existed before. If the donor concept covers their costs then the other vehicles will drive profits (merch, Amazon, etc).

    A key point to my system was aside from a donor flair the site stays the same for everyone. I thought about an Uber tier that was just two trophy points, but even that is a dynamic I didn't think was fitting.

  813. PepeSylvia

    Joined:
    Jan 8, 2015
    Location:
    Wilkes-Barre PA
    Page:
    41
    Post ID:
    1906924
    Date:
    2018-11-12 18:08
    I know everyone has been anxiously waiting for Pepe to chime in... Here are my thoughts.

    I typically lay low, and don't get too involved with many threads, I do read a ton of them. I have been on this site almost daily for the last 3 years. I have been in many BIFs and met some awesome people here as well. Talk beer will always have a special place in my heart, it truly helped me with some of my families darkest days. Not having the strength to talk with family and friends in real life this site and it's fucked up members took me in and listened. Many people were very supportive and reached out in an effort to help, or just to be an available ear. I have been the recipient of very thoughtful and generous gifts, and did my best to return the favor. That is what makes this site a community, and separates us from the rest.

    The new owners are learning that we are not your typical forum, we are more than that. They will make mistakes, they may or may not listen and take our thoughts into consideration. I think talk beer can be successful for us and the new owners if we can understand some need for change and they can understand where so many of us are coming from. It seems to me that they are trying to make us happy and just need to understand the depth of our passion. Change is a constant, all parties need to find balance for this to be a success.

    I would gladly contribute monetarily, or in other ways, to help make this work, so long as we don't turn this into your run if the mill forum, no one wants that.

    If we cannot work together there is enough talent and passion in the last few pages of this thread alone to accomplish whatever we want.

    As a last resort let's just take over the hill farmstead enthusiasts Facebook group.

    TLDR: blah blah blah and stuff

  817. Fenyx Administrator Staff Member

    Joined:
    Sep 18, 2018
    Page:
    41
    Post ID:
    1906977
    Date:
    2018-11-12 19:05
    neorunner said: > ↑ >
    >
    TalkBeer is situated on a dedicated server(s) to serve you as fast as possible. Also we have VPS's to balance the https/file hosting/mail and store traffic along with archive servers retaining older content.
    >
    > Summary of Costs:
    >
      >
    • Dedicated site server
      • >
    • VPS(s) to balance http/https/store/mail/file hosting traffic
      • >
    • Dedicated store servers
      • >
    • Dedicated image hosting
      • >
    • Dedicated server(s) for archiving
      • >
    • Development server
      • >

    > How to Donate
    >
      >
    • Click on the [Donate] button.
      • >
    • Click Buy Now that is adjacent to the amount you intend to donate.
      • >
    • Then select your payment option: Card or Digital Currency
      • >

    > I can't find the donate button
    > The [Donate] button is located next to the [Shop] button. If it is not there then donations are down for the time being. When donations are back up the button will reappear.
    >
    > What happens after I purchase/donate?
    >
      >
    • After a successful 'Purchase', you will receive everything in the package you selected.
      • >
    • The Donation Bar will increase based on your donation/purchase
      • >
    • Funds will be used to finance our servers and other costs
      • >
    • You will receive a donor symbol next to your username in the form of a http://alpharatio.cc/static/common/symbols/donor.png > only if the item(s) you purchased have a value in Days in the "Donor Days" field.
      • >

    > The Following reward sets are available:
    >
      >
    • Sponsor - [Price goes here] - 30 donor days, 2 TB stickers (first purchase only)
      • >
    • Homie - [Price goes here] - 180 donor days, 2 TB stickers (first purchase only)
      • >
    • Junior Mod - [Price goes here] - 1 year donor days, TB Junior Mod glass (first purchase only)
      • >
    • Crazy Pizza Package - [Obnoxious price goes here] - Lifetime donor days, rare swag, limited number available, BadJustin SnapChats, a watch.
      • >

    > All perks will be added to your account within 60 minutes of purchasing, in some instances the cache may cause delays in users seeing the changes.
    >
    > It's been 48 hours and my purchase hasn't completed!
    > Send a PM to a Mod with the subject "Donation Error"
    >
    > Example Donation bar:
    > https://i.imgur.com/0tbO98I.png >
    >
     
    What is a donor day?

  857. trickytunadicky

    Joined:
    Jan 30, 2014
    Location:
    Chicagoish
    Page:
    43
    Post ID:
    1907241
    Date:
    2018-11-13 08:07
    So I know it is considered passe now to complain or ask for a “head’s up” when changes are being tolled out to the site because heaven forbid this be a community that we are expected to support and participate in, but what’s done is done and after a few days of “live beta” of the new mobile layout I have to say, I like how it is friendlier on the eyes (the old people font size is great- I’ll never have to zoom in to see something I might want tonread again) but I don’t like it anyway. I miss the previews. I’ll be clicking away from the site now because I am all caught up and I don’t know which forum has recent posts. I guess I am navigating elsewhere now. If your goal is to keep users on the site and reading, the feature fails.

    Cheers!

    Yeah I haven't noticed any difference on mobile (Android, using Chrome as the browser), but the new avatar settings are messing up with the desktop configuration (Chrome on MacOS, for reference - no idea if it looks different on any other desktop setups). Like, literally half the screen is black sidebars or the column where avatars are located, which constrains the message bodies (i.e. the content I actually care about) to the other half.

    Powzy said: > ↑ >
    >
    I’ve thought a lot about what lurchingbeast told me a couple weeks ago. Has talk beer changed? Short answer, no not really. The only difference is Gene doesn’t own the site. Sure there’s going to be some growing pains. If you’re going to make a big deal out of this, then leave.... talk beer as a community is unchanged the same dickweeds are still here and still post from what I’ve seen.
    >
     
    And really, the site has always changed. The site wasn't the same in June 2018 as it was in 2015. 2015 wasn't the same as April 2013. There's some kind of imaginary 'heyday' in peoples' minds that even if it existed, it didn't exist universally for everyone on the site. I preferred the RTT of 2013 to the ongoing BIF madness of 2015. Doesn't make my 'golden age' any more relevant than yours.

    But I still log on and do whatever I want to do. Post in the threads I want to post, talk to the people I want to talk to. Sure, some of the faces have changed. That's the internet. Nobody is around forever. Sites evolve and everyone is free to migrate to a new place they feel comfortable. This isn't my first forum. It probably won't be my last. I'm down to follow the fun elsewhere if shit gets bad. Things aren't there yet for me, even if there are ominous signs of what's on the horizon for TB.

    Wherever somebody's fighting trying to get banned
    For a hyped stout or a hazy can
    Wherever somebody's shitposting and you disagree
    Look in their eyes, Powz, and you'll see me
    You'll see me
    You'll see me
    [youtube] https://www.youtube.com/embed/iqnMrynpq9U
    Rempo

  877. Gene

    Joined:
    Mar 14, 2013
    Location:
    North Jersey / NYC
    Page:
    44
    Post ID:
    1907313
    Date:
    2018-11-13 10:31
    Gene said: > ↑ >
    >
    tosh - I think more people would have an easier time seeing how much you care about the community if you’d stop gloating over how you predicted it would fall apart, encouraging the mods to quit, watching like a hawk for every misstep and then amplifying them through a megaphone... these are strangely destructive actions for someone whom I actually know cares deeply about this place. So yes, you certainly have been a highly active element in driving things to their current state, and you seem at this point to be acting with intent to destroy it entirely.
    >
    > It doesn’t make sense to me, and it’s why many of us have expressed frustration. It’s not because we “hate you.” I don’t even know you, so I have no basis for that sort of blanket attitude. Our mutual friends tell me you are really a wonderful guy, and I believe them. I am just increasingly confused and frustrated as to why someone who cares so deeply would act so recklessly to accelerate bad outcomes.
    >
     
    As a follow up to the above...

    Following a fair amount of discussion and consideration, and some input from a variety of you all, the mod team (current and former) have collectively agreed that it is time to remove tosh from TalkBeer.

    He’s been a fervent contributor for a long time, and while he’s always been controversial, he had love for the site deep-down. Unfortunately things took a pretty clear turn in recent weeks, and as tosh made increasingly destructive moves throughout the site, it became clear to us that he had given up and seemed to be acting with intent to burn down the community.

    I was not about to stand by and watch someone attempt to destroy what we have here, which is so tremendously valuable to all of us. As I watched him attempt to sabotage the Secret Festivus BIF, repeatedly undermine efforts to improve the current leadership situation, and relish every issue and misstep, my protective instincts kicked in. This decision is how I can best think to protect our community and help Fenyx and BadJustin to steer this ship in the right direction.

    I’ve done everything I could over the years to avoid having to take this step, but today I am confident that it will be a positive turning point for all of us.

    Gene said: > ↑ >
    >
    As a follow up to the above...
    >
    > Following a fair amount of discussion and consideration, and some input from a variety of you all, the mod team (current and former) have collectively agreed that it is time to remove tosh from TalkBeer.
    >
    > He’s been a fervent contributor for a long time, and while he’s always been controversial, he had love for the site deep-down. Unfortunately things took a pretty clear turn in recent weeks, and as tosh made increasingly destructive moves throughout the site, it became clear to us that he had given up and seemed to be acting with intent to burn down the community.
    >
    > I was not about to stand by and watch someone attempt to destroy what we have here, which is so tremendously valuable to all of us. As I watched him attempt to sabotage the Secret Festivus BIF, repeatedly undermine efforts to improve the current leadership situation, and relish every issue and misstep, my protective instincts kicked in. This decision is how I can best think to protect our community and help Fenyx and BadJustin to steer this ship in the right direction.
    >
    > I’ve done everything I could over the years to avoid having to take this step, but today I am confident that it will be a positive turning point for all of us.
    >
     
    Thanks for the heads up.

    Gene said: > ↑ >
    >
    As a follow up to the above...
    >
    > Following a fair amount of discussion and consideration, and some input from a variety of you all, the mod team (current and former) have collectively agreed that it is time to remove tosh from TalkBeer.
    >
    > He’s been a fervent contributor for a long time, and while he’s always been controversial, he had love for the site deep-down. Unfortunately things took a pretty clear turn in recent weeks, and as tosh made increasingly destructive moves throughout the site, it became clear to us that he had given up and seemed to be acting with intent to burn down the community.
    >
    > I was not about to stand by and watch someone attempt to destroy what we have here, which is so tremendously valuable to all of us. As I watched him attempt to sabotage the Secret Festivus BIF, repeatedly undermine efforts to improve the current leadership situation, and relish every issue and misstep, my protective instincts kicked in. This decision is how I can best think to protect our community and help Fenyx and BadJustin to steer this ship in the right direction.
    >
    > I’ve done everything I could over the years to avoid having to take this step, but today I am confident that it will be a positive turning point for all of us.
    >
     
    Whether you agree or disagree with the decision to ban tosh, the fact that Gene communicated this choice reflects poorly on Fenyx. If Fenyx is taking on stewardship of this site, than the potentially controversial decisions should be coming from her - especially if Gene stepped away from mod/admin duties due to a lower level of current involvement.

I felt very strongly that our reasoning was just... and I wanted to explain it, because I know you guys know I don't take the decision to ban someone lightly.

    Is that what you said to Sprout when you cut his tiny, beating artichoke heart from his chest?

  982. iamjeff6

    Joined:
    Nov 19, 2014
    Location:
    Virginia/ West...
    Page:
    50
    Post ID:
    1908034
    Date:
    2018-11-14 07:50
    We start looking for new mods yet? Ill post this again

    Good afternoon, members and staff members! My name is Jeff, and I'm running for mod. I'll keep this quick as I'm sure you are ready to get out of here.

    You might be saying to yourself, "Should Jeff really be a mod? After all, he's only been at this forum for four years."

    It's true that I am fairly new to TalkBeer. At first glance, this may seem like a disadvantage. I didn't attend this forum for my freshman and sophomore years, and I've only known most of you for a couple of years.

    When you think about it though, there is actually a benefit in choosing someone who is coming into the forum from somewhere else. I have new ideas that I can bring in from the forum I was at before.

    Are you tired of doing the same old things year after year? Are you ready to do something different?

    One thing I noticed about this forum when I came last year is that most of the members didn't really get to make any of the decisions here on the forum.

    Did anyone ever ask you what you wanted to do for a fundraiser? Did anyone ever ask you what you wanted to buy with the money we raised? Who makes these decisions?

    Those types of decisions are left up to the mods. The person you choose to represent you as mod will speak for the entire senior class. Do you want to choose someone who will make those decisions for you without knowing what you want?

    If you vote for me as mod, I promise to always get your opinions before making any decisions. You should have a say in the actions that will affect you.

    Every single one of you can come to me with your ideas, and I promise to listen and speak for you.

    I may not be the most well-known person running for mod, but I promise to listen to each and every one of you.

    You matter. Your opinion matters. Don't choose someone who will make all of the decisions for you. Don't vote for the person who will pick whatever their friends want them to choose.

    Choose someone who wants to be your spokesperson. Choose someone who cares about what you want.

    Choose me, Jeff, for your mod

    Good luck Justin. My dad smoked for over 50 years and quit with Chantix a few years ago. He doesn't even like the smell of cigarette smoke now. He did have some complications with his Lupus, which made my mom decide not to use Chantix. So she still smokes, and my dad makes her go outside when she does. Its actually comical to see someone who you have known as a smoker for your entire life, end up getting mad a people for smoking.

  1002. steimie

    Joined:
    Apr 11, 2013
    Location:
    Michigan
    Page:
    51
    Post ID:
    1908292
    Date:
    2018-11-14 14:05
    I quit 3 years ago. I failed with Chantix and actually had horrible, awful dreams and other complications on Chantix. I quit after I got influenza and was basically stuck in bed for 3 weeks. Once I started to feel better, I lit a smoke, inhaled, and damn near coughed up my lung. That was it for me.

    I miss it every single day. I'm not going to start up again, but I really miss it sometimes. The fact that I blew up like a beach ball after quitting probably doesn't help, either.

    Good luck, Justin. If you really want to quit, you can do it.

    I quit for a full year and now am back. It's so fucking hard to quit. The stress of moving across the country and the fact that all my friends smoked didn't help.
